intro: Kampmannia fraxinifolium, commonly known as the ash-leaf kampmannia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It is characterized by its compound leaves, which resemble those of the ash tree, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are typically arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Rubiaceae family.
